availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, soldier. Harrison County, Kentucky. native. Son of Abram Dunn and Agnes H. Dunn. Married to Melissa Dunn Dunn in Harrison County, Kentucky, on December 8, 1859. Father of Joanna Dunn, William Dunn, Thomas Dunn, and Elizabeth Dunn. Resident of Harrison County in 1850. Resident of Harrison County in 1860. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private, corporal, and sergeant from September 22, 1862 to July 14, 1865. Reported as deserted from Sumter County, Tennessee, on December 20, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 134B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, Cordova, p. 485B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0107.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, X County Marriages, Film 000216888.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 276-7.
